verses.verse: Why<WG5105> seeing we also<WG2532> are compassed<WG4029> about<WG4029> with so<WG5118> great<WG5118> a cloud<WG3509> of witnesses,<WG3144> let us lay<WG659> aside<WG659> every<WG3956> weight,<WG3591> and the sin<WG266> which does so easily beset<WG2139> us, and let us run<WG5143> with patience<WG5281> the race<WG73> that is set<WG4295> before<WG4295> us,

Looking<WG872> to Jesus<WG2424> the author<WG747> and finisher<WG5047> of our faith;<WG4102> who<WG3739> for the joy<WG5479> that was set<WG4295> before<WG4295> him endured<WG5278> the cross,<WG4716> despising<WG2706> the shame,<WG152> and is set<WG2523> down<WG2523> at<WG1722> the right<WG1188> hand of the throne<WG2362> of God.<WG2316>

For consider<WG357> him that endured<WG5278> such<WG5108> contradiction<WG485> of sinners<WG268> against<WG1519> himself,<WG848> lest<WG2443> <WG3361> you be wearied<WG2577> and faint<WG1590> in your<WG5216> minds.<WG5590>
You have not yet<WG3768> resisted<WG478> to blood,<WG129> striving<WG464> against<WG4314> sin.<WG266>

And you have forgotten<WG1585> the exhortation<WG3874> which<WG3748> speaks<WG1256> to you as to children,<WG5207> My son,<WG5207> despise<WG3643> not you the chastening<WG3809> of the Lord,<WG2962> nor<WG3366> faint<WG1590> when you are rebuked<WG1651> of him:
For whom<WG3739> the Lord<WG2962> loves<WG25> he chastens,<WG3811> and whips<WG3146> every<WG3956> son<WG5207> whom<WG3739> he receives.<WG3858>
If<WG1487> you endure<WG5278> chastening,<WG3809> God<WG2316> deals<WG4374> with you as with sons;<WG5207> for what<WG5101> son<WG5207> is he whom<WG3739> the father<WG3962> chastens<WG3811> not?
But if<WG1487> you be without<WG5565> chastisement,<WG3809> whereof<WG3739> all<WG3956> are partakers,<WG3353> then<WG686> are you bastards,<WG3541> and not sons.<WG5207>

Furthermore<WG1534> we have<WG2192> had<WG2192> fathers<WG3962> of our flesh<WG4561> which corrected<WG3810> us, and we gave<WG1788> them reverence:<WG1788> shall we not much<WG4183> rather<WG3123> be in subjection<WG5293> to the Father<WG3962> of spirits,<WG4151> and live?<WG2198>

For they truly<WG3303> for a few<WG3641> days<WG2250> chastened<WG3811> us after<WG2596> their own<WG848> pleasure;<WG3588> <WG1380> but he for our profit,<WG4851> that we might be partakers<WG3335> of his holiness.<WG41>

Now<WG1161> no<WG3956> <WG3756> chastening<WG3809> for the present<WG3918> seems<WG1380> to be joyous,<WG5479> but grievous:<WG3077> nevertheless<WG1161> afterward<WG5305> it yields<WG591> the peaceable<WG1516> fruit<WG2590> of righteousness<WG1343> to them which are exercised<WG1128> thereby.<WG1223> <WG846>
Why<WG1352> lift<WG461> up the hands<WG5495> which hang<WG3935> down,<WG3935> and the feeble<WG3886> knees;<WG1119>

And make<WG4160> straight<WG3717> paths<WG5163> for your<WG5216> feet,<WG4228> lest<WG2443> <WG3361> that which is lame<WG5560> be turned<WG1624> out of the way;<WG1624> but let it rather<WG3123> be healed.<WG2390>
Follow<WG1377> peace<WG1515> with all<WG3956> men, and holiness,<WG38> without<WG5565> which<WG3739> no<WG3762> man<WG3762> shall see<WG3700> the Lord:<WG2962>

Looking<WG1983> diligently lest<WG3361> any<WG5100> man fail<WG5302> of the grace<WG5485> of God;<WG2316> lest<WG3361> any<WG5100> root<WG4491> of bitterness<WG4088> springing<WG5453> up trouble<WG1776> you, and thereby<WG1223> <WG5026> many<WG4183> be defiled;<WG3392>
Lest there be any<WG5100> fornicator,<WG4205> or<WG2228> profane<WG952> person, as Esau,<WG2269> who<WG3739> for one<WG3391> morsel<WG1035> of meat<WG1035> sold<WG591> his birthright.<WG4415>

For you know<WG2467> how<WG3754> that afterward,<WG3347> when he would<WG2309> have<WG2192> inherited<WG2816> the blessing,<WG2129> he was rejected:<WG593> for he found<WG2147> no<WG3756> place<WG5117> of repentance,<WG3341> though<WG2539> he sought<WG1567> it carefully<WG1567> with tears.<WG1144>

For you are not come<WG4334> to the mount<WG3735> that might be touched,<WG5584> and that burned<WG2545> with fire,<WG4442> nor<WG2532> to blackness,<WG1105> and darkness,<WG4655> and tempest,<WG2366>

And the sound<WG2279> of a trumpet,<WG4536> and the voice<WG5456> of words;<WG4487> which<WG3739> voice they that heard<WG191> entreated<WG3868> that the word<WG3056> should not be spoken<WG4369> to them any<WG2089> more:<WG4369>

(For they could not endure<WG5342> that which was commanded,<WG1291> And if so much<WG2579> as a beast<WG2342> touch<WG2345> the mountain,<WG3735> it shall be stoned,<WG3036> or<WG2228> thrust<WG2700> through<WG2700> with a dart:<WG1002>
And so<WG3779> terrible<WG5398> was the sight,<WG5324> that Moses<WG3475> said,<WG2036> I exceedingly<WG1630> fear<WG1630> <WG1510> and quake:<WG1790>)

But you are come<WG4334> to mount<WG3735> Sion,<WG4622> and to the city<WG4172> of the living<WG2198> God,<WG2316> the heavenly<WG2032> Jerusalem,<WG2419> and to an innumerable<WG3461> company<WG3461> of angels,<WG32>

To the general<WG3831> assembly<WG3831> and church<WG1577> of the firstborn,<WG4416> which are written<WG583> in heaven,<WG3772> and to God<WG2316> the Judge<WG2923> of all,<WG3956> and to the spirits<WG4151> of just<WG1342> men made<WG5048> perfect,<WG5048>
And to Jesus<WG2424> the mediator<WG3316> of the new<WG3501> covenant,<WG1242> and to the blood<WG129> of sprinkling,<WG4473> that speaks<WG2980> better<WG2909> things than<WG3844> that of Abel.<WG6>

See<WG991> that you refuse<WG3868> not him that speaks.<WG2980> For if<WG1487> they escaped<WG5343> not who refused<WG3868> him that spoke<WG5537> on<WG1909> earth,<WG1093> much<WG4183> more<WG3123> shall not we escape,<WG5343> if we turn<WG654> away<WG654> from him that speaks from heaven:<WG3772>

Whose<WG3739> voice<WG5456> then<WG5119> shook<WG4531> the earth:<WG1093> but now<WG3568> he has promised,<WG1861> saying,<WG3004> Yet<WG2089> once<WG530> more I shake<WG4579> not the earth<WG1093> only,<WG3440> but also<WG2532> heaven.<WG3772>

And this<WG3588> word, Yet<WG2089> once<WG530> more, signifies<WG1213> the removing<WG3331> of those<WG3588> things that are shaken,<WG4531> as of things that are made,<WG4160> that those<WG3588> things which cannot<WG3361> be shaken<WG4531> may remain.<WG3306>

Why<WG1352> we receiving<WG3880> a kingdom<WG932> which cannot<WG761> be moved,<WG761> let us have<WG2192> grace,<WG5485> whereby<WG1223> <WG3739> we may serve<WG3000> God<WG2316> acceptably<WG2102> with reverence<WG127> and godly fear:<WG2124>
For our God<WG2316> is a consuming<WG2654> fire.<WG4442>
